bhtAttempts.bht: The disciples were greatly saddened when they finally understood that Jesus was speaking of his impending death and resurrection, which he had been teaching them about in the previous chapter. Their sorrow stemmed from a mixture of natural affection and the realization that their false hopes of Jesus establishing an earthly kingdom were dashed. This misunderstanding persisted despite Jesus' efforts to impart this knowledge more accurately to them. The disciples overlooked the hope of Jesus rising again from the dead, causing them to struggle in reconciling the betrayal and suffering that awaited him with their expectations of an everlasting and glorious kingdom. Men, it seems, are often slow to grasp the true meaning of Jesus' death and resurrection.
